intro: Diplotaxis vicentina, commonly known as the Spanish flax or mountain flax, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant features slender, upright stems and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and covered in fine hairs, giving them a slightly rough texture. Diplotaxis vicentina is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, coastal environments.
